intro: Hexadesmia brachyphylla, commonly known as the dwarf starflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Hexadesmia brachyphylla is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth.
